Context:
Program Name: Culinary Skills
Code: H134
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $7,732.00 *
International Tuition: $21,770.00 **
Centre: Hospitality & Culinary Arts
School: Chef School
Location: St. James Campus
Program Description: Learn the fundamentals of food preparation and develop cooking skills under professional chefs. Explore various culinary movements and broaden your knowledge for a career in the food service industry.
Skills gained: core cooking and baking skills, appreciation for nutrition, menu planning, solid knife skills and cooking techniques.
* Domestic tuition may be subject to change.
** International tuition may be subject to change and does not include additional fees or expenses.

Context:
Extracted Information:

The George Brown College Chef School offers various classes that run from early morning to late evening. The demand for culinary skills is high in Toronto and internationally, with over 7,500 restaurants, hotel dining rooms, cafés, eateries, clubs, resorts, spas, and catering companies.

Graduates of the George Brown College Chef School may qualify for direct entry to the second year of the Culinary Management diploma program. The following courses are required in Semester 1:
- HOST1068: Smart Serve
- HOSF1184: Café Production
- HOSF1185: Fundamentals of Butchery
- HOSF1255: Nutrition Fundamentals from a Culinary Perspective
- HOSF1002: Baking and Pastry for Cooks
- HOSF1202: Culinary Foundations
- HOSF1203: Culinary Essentials
- HOSF1029: Theory of Food I
- HOSF1145: Sanitation
- HOSF1146: Emergency First Aid/Heartsaver CPR (weekend course)
- MATH1200: Culinary Math Essentials
- COMM2000: Communicating Across Contexts
- GSCI1035: Science of Sustainability

The following courses are required in Semester 2:
- HOSF1287: WHMIS
- HOSF1166: Foods of the World
- HOSF1204: Culinary Principles
- HOSF1205: Culinary Concepts
- HOSF1031: Theory of Food II
- HOST1005: Food, Beverage and Labour Cost Control (hybrid)
- HOSF1296: Beverage and Service Fundamentals
- HOSF1297: The Sustainable Chef
- HOST1126: Career Preparation

Some courses are seven-week courses, and students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000. However, COMM 1000 does not count as a course required for the Culinary Management diploma program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Culinary Skills Program H134 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Provide fundamental culinary preparation and presentation for various food service environments using classical and contemporary techniques.
- Apply basic food and bake science to food preparation.
- Contribute to a well-maintained kitchen environment and ensure safe food handling.
- Develop menu options that reflect nutrition and food ingredients, respond to various nutritional needs, and address modifications for special diets, food allergies, and intolerances.
- Apply fundamental business principles and industry costing and control practices to food service operations.
- Use technology for food production and promotion.
- Perform effectively as a food and beverage preparation and service team member.
- Develop strategies for continuous personal and professional learning.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $7,732.00
- International Tuition: $21,770.00
- Additional costs (not included in tuition): estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023.
- Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.

Note: This information is factual and extracted from the text provided.

Context: The George Brown College offers various programs, including Culinary Management (H100), Cook Apprentice (H601), and Culinary Management (Integrated Learning) (H116). Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admission web page. Financial and fees-related inquiries can be directed to the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or the Financial Aid web page. For Culinary Skills program-related inquiries, contact CHCAStudentSupport@georgebrown.ca. George Brown College has a Contact Centre that can be reached at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002, and international students can contact recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin through the International Contact Us page. The college holds Discovery Days where interested individuals can learn more about their area of interest and visit facilities. Crystal and Celeste Ceres are alumni of the Culinary Skills program and founded Sacraspice, a charity that delivers cooking workshops to teach young people essential culinary skills. Their motto is Bringing Healthy Back.
